parameters: Well,\. how the hell are we gonna get across that?\.
We don't even have the luxury of any apparent \C[6]tool\C[0]
clues around to indicate what should be coming next...
Hey maybe it's this \C[1]lady in a labcoat\C[0] over here!
What are you two babbling about here now?
Aren't you the next story device?
You do look like you know some things!\.
The bridge-\. as you can clearly see-\. is quite flooded.
It has been this way for \C[2]about a week now\C[0].\.
I suspect it has to do with the \C[1]water demon\C[0] that has
taken up residence down in the \C[1]forlorn basin\C[0].
You mean the \C[2]pudding\C[0] we slayed down there?
Then perhaps this is a task for you two.
I'm a mechanical engineer- aka inventor.
So you're not from here either.
I am indeed a \C[1]human\C[0],\. just like you \C[2]\N[2]\C[0].
My vessel was attacked \C[1]a few weeks ago\C[0] and my escape pod
landed here on this planet.\. I wandered around until I made it
I recall hearing a mess of whispers about you two when you
first arrived, I was actually at the bar when you two
showed up,\. but left to investigate this so-called \C[1]Erocia Kingdom\C[0].
Well fortunately, we're been around the block a time or two
before this,\. so \C[2]adventuring in foreign worlds\C[0] is nothing
However,\. being gated by all these stupid \C[1]tools\C[0] thanks
to our \C[2]inconsiderate dev overlord\C[0] has made THIS particular
Well, then you two being \C[1]extraplanetary beings\C[0] like myself makes
saves me the trouble of explaining things.
The \C[2]source of this flooding\C[0] is because there is a geographic
surge that somehow appears to be \C[1]redirecting water\C[0] that
originates up in the \C[2]negative peaks\C[0] to the north of \C[3]Raevula\C[0].
My speculation is that this "geographic surge" is actually some
form of a \C[1]water entity\C[0]-\. this world seems to have no
shortage of elemental demons and monsters, it seems.
I would imagine if you two could... \_deal\_ with the entity,\.
then the water levels would \C[1]return to normal\C[0] not just
here, but \C[2]everywhere the water levels are abnormal\C[0].
I'm pretty sure of all the work she just asked us to do,\. no
where did she mention free recipes or anything related to
I didn't hear anything about any of that either,\. \N[1].
What are you two buffoons blabbering about now?\.
Oh, yeah its not that we can't do what you asked...\.
We are just \C[2]strongly motivated\C[0] by material things.\.
Such as recipes to craft new food, or \C[2]tools to access new areas\C[0]\..\..\..
\C[6]Treis hands you a bag of what appear to be classic,
You can throw those on the ground, and they'll explode not just
by proximity, but also after \C[1]about five seconds\C[0]- whichever
I coded the bombs to not actually cause any material damage to
\C[3]the player or their allies\C[0],\. but it will most certainly
damage any foes if they happen to be in the blast radius.
This appears to be...\. a new tool...
What if we run out because we were excitedly planting bombs
Well,\. I'll wait in \C[3]Raevula\C[0] then,\. and if you
run out, I can make some more bombs-\. for a price.
Just try not to take too much time dealing with that pesky
I have things I need to investigate,\. and this flooding has really
set me back in my research.
I didn't mean to come to this planet,\.
but since I'm here, I figure I may as well make the best of an
otherwise rather shitty situation I've found myself in.
That's a great way to keep positive!
I'll be \C[1]renting a room in the \C[6]Comfy Bear\C[1] in \C[3]Raevula\C[0].\.
So you can find me there.
So we're heading for the \C[7]forlorn basin\C[0], into it's
depths,\. to find some supposed water entity and kill it so that
the flooding will... somehow undo itself?
Yeah\..\..\.. I guess that is how water works?\. I'm not sure.
It started to sound like that lady was just getting us to do
Well,\. we have these nifty \C[2]bombs\C[0] now,\. so maybe
that'll unlock some new options for us?
We will need to \C[1]be responsible about our bomb usage\C[0], though.\.
She did say that she could make more for us, but that there
Bah,\. we'll deal with that when the time comes.\.
I'm sure its just \Armor[361] and \Armor[321] or something
that has absolutely nothing to do with bombs.
We'll find her \C[3]in Raevula's inn\C[0] and figure that out
\C[2]Bombs\C[6], or better known as \Item[122]\C[6]s,\. are another tool
that you can use to destroy objects that are more durable than spires.
(but this will also destroy \C[1]grey spires\C[6] as well!
\C[6]Try it on things that \C[2]look like their structural integrity
is compromised\C[6],\. maybe you'll be able to open new paths!
